paper_abstract: G(k) (geometrically continuous surface) constructions were developed to create surfaces that are smooth also at irregular points where, in a quad-mesh, three or more than four elements come together. Isogeometric elements were developed to unify the representation of geometry and of engineering analysis. We show how matched G(k) constructions for geometry and analysis automatically yield C-k isogeometric elements. This provides a formal framework for the existing and any future isogeometric elements based on geometric continuity. Crown Copyright CD (C) 2015 Published by Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Matched G(k)-constructions always yield C-k-continuous isogeometric elements
